column1: It appears if Congress wants to get a full answer on the justification for the Soleimani strike or other decisions by the President that bring our nation to the brink of war we need to pay to attend a Mar-a-Lago fundraiser  Or we can insist by passing the War Powers Resolution. https://t.co/3UZtxg1JxJ

More results are in from the Republican tax cut:  The big banks saved $32 BILLION in taxes while enriching shareholders and laying off workers.   Which means it's working exactly as everyone predicted. https://t.co/BSuuCDkEPC

Texas Democrats are launching an aggressive operation to register voters and defend their constitutional rights.   The GOP’s voter suppression is a flawed and unethical strategy. In 2020 we must make it a failed strategy.   Everyone must have a voice in our democracy. https://t.co/hAFEBJh0Wh

Today the House did its duty.  Because American voters not foreign powers decide our elections.  Because a president cannot abuse his power to cheat in an election and then obstruct Congress's investigation.  The people want a fair trial in the Senate. Let’s hope they get it.

Trump who famously stiffed his workers and contractors has now made it easier for other companies to do the same.  California serves as a model for protecting against wage theft. Now we need to strengthen labor laws across the country so that all workers can be treated fairly. https://t.co/N3QqSH1iwH

Trump is asking the court to strike down the entire Affordable Care Act.  If he gets his way 20 million Americans would lose insurance.  People with preexisting conditions would lose all protections.    House Democrats were elected to protect your healthcare.  And we will. https://t.co/PFZBZuKRyG

Many of our Democratic freshmen served in military and other national security roles as was evident in this week's debate about war powers.  As Rep. Slotkin said “If our loved ones are going to be sent to fight“ the American people though their legislators should have a say. https://t.co/aet74p1nTn

The Founders gave Congress not the President the power to declare war.  For too long Congress has abdicated its responsibility.  If there was ever a time to reclaim our constitutional power it is now.  When the nation has such a reckless man at the helm. https://t.co/4wCIG8h8RW
This is a no brainer:  Election Day should be a national holiday.  The only reason not to?  If you don't want more people to vote. https://t.co/LBZQ3RASEb

The former GOP congressman who @ElaineLuriaVA beat in 2018 is running again and he has some complaints about “these girls” with national security backgrounds.  “These girls” are some of the brightest toughest most capable leaders in Congress.  And they’re not going anywhere. https://t.co/randcRjk0Q

The Founders gave Congress — and only Congress — the power to declare war.  A decision which could imperil so many should not be left to the whims of one impulsive man.  It’s time to reclaim our power and uphold our duty. https://t.co/xzkBSfyaIF

In 21 states from Arkansas to California workers are getting a raise.  As the GOP cut taxes for big business and billionaires @fightfor15 and union power increased the minimum wage for 7 million.  It’s time for the Senate to pass our bill to raise it across the country. https://t.co/yD99SOmbrV

Every New Year’s eve as the clock strikes midnight I say “rabbit rabbit” to bring luck throughout the year to come.  Give it a try tonight! I hope it brings you and your family and friends good luck in the New Year.

We knew the GOP’s tax cuts benefited the wealthy.  But that was just the beginning.  Big banks and corporations lobbied hard for loopholes and giveaways.  And the Trump Administration gave them what they wanted — at the cost of billions in taxpayer dollars. https://t.co/2yKOP7Skk0
Happy Holidays from the Schiff family! We wish you peace love and joy as you relax with those you love. https://t.co/XQ3LYsOhJE

The newly-enacted spending bill includes large new investments to address homelessness thanks to House Democrats.   I’ve also introduced legislation to help cities like ours invest in new affordable housing.  Let’s make 2020 the year we ended homelessness. https://t.co/kZpAXFAoSt
Over 4000 mental health care providers are striking in California.  I support Kaiser workers and @NUHW who are fighting for patients and a fair deal.  https://t.co/rqwDYjpNEp https://t.co/4bSlkREVKS

We did not come to Congress to impeach this President.  We came to fight for health care gun reform voting rights equal pay.   But history called upon us to uphold our oath. And we have.  Together we will emerge from this dark chapter.  And make our democracy stronger still.

This is why we had to move forward with articles of impeachment:  The threat persists.   The plot goes on.  And Trump’s efforts to cheat in the next election will never stop.  The President — and his lawyer — continue to make the case for his own removal. https://t.co/gtvyCHg2xl

The President has said that under Article 2 he can do whatever he wants.  That’s what happens in a monarchy not a republic.  And as Ben Franklin said America is “a republic if you can keep it.”  That is the question right now: can we keep this republic? https://t.co/DxMSuhQDCL

“These neighborhoods are our neighborhoods and these children are our children.”  In the years since Sandy Hook we’ve mobilised passed legislation won elections on gun reform.  Let’s remember this tragic day. Then let’s redouble our efforts. https://t.co/gfe6LMyqR2

The Founders gave Congress the impeachment power in case:  ✓An unethical person would become president and abuse their power.  ✓They would seek to have a foreign power interfere in our affairs.  ✓They would do so in order to prejudice an election.  A situation just like this. https://t.co/ikrAiBqb9b

This is not just about prior conduct.  It is about what is going on today:  As the president and his allies continue to seek foreign interference in our elections.  It never stopped.  It never will stop.  Unless we put an end to it. https://t.co/d1NfsUVPBY

Trump as a candidate said he wanted to negotiate drug prices “like crazy.”  The House just passed H.R. 3 to do just that and lower costs for all.   We’re keeping our promise to make health care affordable for all Americans. Will he? https://t.co/0phu5L24Lo

If you need more proof that elections matter Kentucky’s new Democratic governor’s @AndyBeshearKY first act will be to restore voting rights to 140000 Kentuckians.   In his words it’s about treating everyone “with dignity and respect” because “everyone counts” in a democracy. https://t.co/4Mq50LADXA

A police chief’s anguish a tragic reminder of how police officers are on the front lines of our gun violence crisis.  We must do more to ensure their safety and the safety of all Americans.  The Senate can start by reauthorizing VAWA and voting on our background check bills. https://t.co/Xy5vcfChDU

Number of House Republicans who voted in favor of:  H.R. 6400 the 1965 Voting Rights Act: 112  H.R. 9 the 2006 bill to reauthorize it: 192  H.R. 4 yesterday’s bill to restore it: 1  Why? The GOP’s hopes depend on fewer people voting.

The do-everything House has passed 275 bipartisan bills this year. So if Americans want:  ✓Lower prescription drug costs  ✓Background checks  ✓Voting rights   ✓Fair pay  ✓Equality  ✓Climate action  and more ask Mitch McConnell when the do-nothing Senate is going to act. https://t.co/OfZZGqstRw

Instead of supporting our ally Ukraine in its war against our adversary Russia the President tried to enlist Zelensky to do his political dirty work.  Trump withheld hundreds of millions in military aid Ukraine desperately needed to force them to help his reelection effort. https://t.co/vYBAPlQKAe

Kamala Harris brought the same passionate talented advocacy to the campaign trail that she has shown throughout her career. The Golden State is lucky to have her.  I know she'll never stop fighting for the values that we share.

It’s not too late to take advantage of our Black Friday sale!   Today only receive a 10% discount when you support Adam at our merch store.  Visit https://t.co/TRljovVGBI and use offer code SCHIFF10. https://t.co/nC6BzJr0uG
From my family to yours Happy Thanksgiving! https://t.co/v4L6deSMqQ

A new U.N. report shows the gravity of the global climate change crisis.  The costs are clear: extreme weather wildfires huge disruptions to lives livelihoods and the economy.  It’s time for decisive action. We owe it to our children grandchildren and planet. https://t.co/bPDRucepqy

Rep. Lucy McBath knows: “Courage is turning pain into progress.”   She had the courage to turn an unfathomable loss into a mission to protect America’s children.  Stories like hers are why we must keep fighting for gun safety and people like her are why we will succeed. https://t.co/9AwGyoOwj9

Trump in 2016: ”When it comes time to negotiate the cost of drugs we are going to negotiate like crazy.”  Trump in 2019: Bashes House bill to do exactly that.  Americans are crippled by high prescription drug costs. He promised he would make a deal for them.   Promise broken. https://t.co/t4KObF1jm0

We have overwhelming evidence that the President abused his office to seek foreign help in his 2020 re-election campaign and withheld military aid and a WH meeting to get it.  Worse yet he is likely to seek foreign help again.  That’s why it’s so urgent that we move forward. https://t.co/Xw48rnNjlu

The Secret Service spent over $250k at Trump properties in just 5 months.  How much taxpayer money has gone into Trump’s pocket?  We still don’t know. I’ve introduced a bill requiring disclosure.  We should know the price tag for the President’s lack of basic ethics. https://t.co/Om5fUPhMpD

The President has repeatedly threatened to punish the owner of the Washington Post because he dislikes the paper’s reporting.  The evidence is growing that the threats were more than just talk.    We must strongly condemn all attacks on the free press. https://t.co/UKk7Jj2ReO

Without you there would have been no Blue Wave.  No oversight no restraint no guardrail.  You believed in our democracy. And you fought for it. And you fight for it still.  Your activism is the engine of the Democratic Party.  And your vote is going to save our country. https://t.co/lhaVJUj0oE

We cannot have a President who believes he can abuse the power of his office and fail to defend our national security and not be held accountable.  That is just too dangerous a prospect for our country. https://t.co/Kd198goWbR

A senior HHS official spent millions on PR consultants including to "burnish [her] personal brand" while undermining Obamacare and causing thousands of Americans to lose Medicaid.  If they stopped trying to take away your healthcare they wouldn't need the consultants at all. https://t.co/AUOTfQiV84

The House passed a background check bill over 250 days ago.   After the El Paso and Dayton shootings Trump pledged he would work with Congress on it.  Now he’s nowhere to be found. Same with Mitch McConnell.  Americans are paying for their inaction with their lives.

Today a state court found Mr. Trump breached his duty to his charity and used the money it raised "to further Mr. Trump's political campaign."  A breach of duty to help his campaign.  Congress must not be blind to the man’s immorality or consistency. https://t.co/74K4ulFd23

Today voters in Virginia Kentucky Mississippi and many other states will take part in elections with huge impacts on health care redistricting gun safety equal rights fair wages and more.  We can never take our right to vote for granted. Go out and make your voices heard. https://t.co/pFW3PklcRd

The Second Circuit Court of Appeals has ruled that Trump’s tax returns need to be provided to NY prosecutors.   It rejected Trump’s absolute immunity argument as "repugnant to the nation's governmental structure and constitutional values."  Repugnant. Exactly the right word.

The American people have a right to know — indeed they have a need to know — how deep the president’s misconduct goes.  Our job is to give them the facts and that’s just what we’re doing.  https://t.co/yoi3vLcYXR

In Wisconsin the stakes are high up and down the ballot.  Drawing fair maps flipping the state legislature shoring up our House majority.   With the GOP spending millions @WisDems are fighting back with grassroots power. They need your help:   https://t.co/WPNHNaq9Xj

Yesterday’s House resolution authorizes the release of transcripts of our witness depositions a process that could begin as early as next week.  These transcripts and witnesses' public testimony will give Americans a pretty clear picture of the President’s misconduct. https://t.co/0YIv25tSbp

The Framers understood a president might sacrifice our national security fail to defend the Constitution and place his personal interests above all else. And they prescribed a remedy: impeachment.   We take no joy in this inquiry but nor do we shrink from our responsibility. https://t.co/dKUTCG3aCB

Ahead of the 2018 elections Georgia purged hundreds of thousands of voters from the rolls and held back applications for tens of thousands more.  Now with two Senators on the ballot in 2020 they’re doing it again.  This is why we must keep fighting to defend voting rights. https://t.co/yeTWIl4aXY

The Trump Administration has rolled back enforcement on payday lenders who prey on vulnerable Americans.  It could get worse. An industry leader bragged that his campaign donations get him access to Trump.  It's an egregious example of putting big donors ahead of working people. https://t.co/dQRTbpT9jd

North Carolina courts ruled that their heavily gerrymandered congressional maps violate the state constitution.  They’ve ordered them redrawn for 2020.  This is a victory for North Carolinians and democracy.  We need fair maps. https://t.co/lH2EHplr38

It was bittersweet to say goodbye to my colleague Elijah Cummings.  As President Obama said so beautifully many elected officials are given the title “honorable.”  Too few of them embody it as Elijah did.  We will miss our dear friend and honor his memory with service. https://t.co/ul1U2xGPm1

The student vote doubled between 2014 and 2018.  Republican legislators are doing all they can to make sure it never happens again.  Students have a stake in climate change gun reform college debt and more.  Let’s protect their right to vote. And let their voices be heard. https://t.co/n0TIpoBfwg

This week the House passed legislation to prevent foreign election interference. Again.  Also this week Senate Republicans objected to legislation to prevent foreign election interference. Again.  What will it take for them to protect our democracy? https://t.co/7lcGjtmob3

A House investigation found Secretary DeVos let for-profit colleges fake their accreditations and offer loans for which they were ineligible.  The schools shut their doors leaving students hanging and deep in debt.  This is plain wrong. We must stand for students not profits. https://t.co/deSuAkDPPv
It’s in the United States Constitution the one you took an oath to preserve protect and defend. https://t.co/m8B0Uftj8y
I’ve often said that the evidence of Trump’s self-dealing is in plain sight.  But this is shameless even for him.  We can't normalize or accept this blatant corruption. https://t.co/tviLXgtTXb

New Trump tax documents show major inconsistencies:  One set of numbers for lenders.  Another for the tax authorities.  It's hard to be outraged or even surprised.  But we should be. The swamp is wide and deep. https://t.co/s3u707zDA0
This is what real strength and leadership look like.   Thanks for standing up for our allies and our values #MadameSpeaker. https://t.co/M3wOmyAiFb

A former marine who led U.S. forces against ISIS calls Trump’s withdrawal of support for the Kurds “gut-wrenching.”  He tells it like it is: this is a betrayal of people who fought side by side with us against ISIS. The damage to our security and credibility are incalculable. https://t.co/LrN1GlPBOB

For decades EPA scientists wrote reports on air pollution that can make people sick.  Then the Trump Administration fired them.  For love of country the scientists wrote the report anyway.  What we need now is a government that takes them — and our health — just as seriously. https://t.co/v09PXGdIoG

Trump’s decision to betray our Kurdish allies in Syria and risk release of ISIS fighters has been condemned by both parties. Why would he do it? Who knows. But here were his words in 2015:  “I have a little conflict of interest because I have a major major building in Istanbul.” https://t.co/BfDqSSDkQG

Trump promised to save the U.S. manufacturing sector.  Instead his trade policies and erratic actions have driven it into an avoidable recession.  Millions of jobs are now at risk a tragic result that was all too predictable. https://t.co/xjbUxybtFG

Today at the last moment the White House prevented an important witness from testifying or providing communications.   Any effort to cover up the President’s misconduct will only add to the evidence that Trump is obstructing the constitutional duties of Congress. https://t.co/G3lLV0VWox

For the first time on record the richer you get the less tax you pay.   Working Americans pay a larger share than billionaires.   It starves our government of resources for healthcare social security infrastructure and education.   The GOP thinks this is just fine. We don’t. https://t.co/Q5rmvcFRsQ

First we learned Trump not only sought to coerce Ukraine into helping him in the next election but that the State Department itself was pressed into the service of this corrupt aim.  Then Trump claimed abusing his office this way was his right.  And that was just this week.

The evidence is clear: the ACA saves lives.  20 million people who now have healthcare know it first hand.  So what are the Trump Administration and GOP doing?  Trying to take it away from as many of them as possible.  The House is fighting for you. We will not go back. https://t.co/ykztA4KnoN

ICYMI: The House continues working on legislation to help Americans.  -Lowering prescription drug costs  -Rebuilding our infrastructure  -Clean government and voting rights  -Gun safety  We’ll work with anyone on these issues. Including the president.  We have a country to run. https://t.co/rC4p7YydTV
Sending my best wishes to @BernieSanders for a speedy recovery. I hope he's feeling better and back on the campaign trail as soon as possible.
Thank you Mr. President.   I’m always flattered when I’m attacked by someone of your character. https://t.co/7gJ5QyFD8g

Trump has admitted to pressuring a foreign country to manufacture dirt on his political opponent even as he withheld military aid to that country.  This is a profound abuse of office and danger to national security.  I fully support support the House’s impeachment inquiry.
I support good middle class jobs and I support quality affordable healthcare.  That’s why I stand with workers at Kaiser and @seiu_uhw in their fight for both. https://t.co/tSgCbSEa7s

Watching millions of people across the world march for action on climate change was moving and inspiring.  If we can have global action we can have global cooperation — and that’s exactly what we'll need to make real progress on climate change. https://t.co/UqfnDPhHvN

Trump says everybody has read the whistleblower complaint and they laugh at it.  Congress hasn’t read it and we're not laughing.  And if Trump is the subject of the complaint it’s all the more urgent and the cover up even more pernicious.  Congress must see the complaint. Now. https://t.co/Z332aWSmTO

The Inspector General found the whistleblower complaint involves “one of the most significant and important of the DNI's responsibilities to the American people.”  He found it to be both credible and urgent.  And it’s being withheld from Congress.  It will be brought to light. https://t.co/uWmWjq2zcw

California has always led the way in reducing greenhouse gas emissions and improving air quality. Naturally the Trump Administration is outraged and is trying to stop us.  The law is on our side and we’ll fight to put children and our planet first not big donors and polluters. https://t.co/tPWwUfDTvl

Brett Kavanaugh should never have been confirmed.  Against highly credible allegations he responded with a partisan diatribe that revealed a man lacking the character and judgement fit for the bench.  The FBI was precluded from interviewing key witnesses. We should find out why. https://t.co/hsy9w5df2E

My former intern and friend @AdyBarkan is a tireless advocate of the idea that healthcare is a human right.  It is and I’m filled with admiration at his courage in fighting for millions of Americans.  Ady’s new book Eyes to the Wind comes out tomorrow. Here’s a passage: https://t.co/xJ86BssCNt

It turns out that the GOP has other plans beyond raiding Medicare and Social Security to fix the debt they exploded.  They also want to repeal the Affordable Care Act.  This is the exact same agenda that the country rejected in the 2018 midterms.  And will reject again. https://t.co/epVuFPgZnA

Last time the GOP was in charge it passed a massive tax cut for the richest Americans. @gopleader said it would pay for itself - yet our debt soared.  Now they want to use the debt they created to cut Social Security and Medicare.  Thank goodness they won’t get the chance. https://t.co/pVnoiFGnDY

The tragic yet predictable result of Trump’s policies:  A big increase in uninsured Americans for the first time since the ACA was passed.  Millions have lost access to healthcare in the last year alone.   And if the GOP gets their way in court this is only the beginning. https://t.co/DV5tX9yoXM

Bolton’s poor temperament and lack of judgment always made him a poor fit for National Security Advisor.   And the constant turnover and chaos in this administration come at a real cost to our national security.  The risks are only mounting... https://t.co/kQ9WNMInvq

When John Bolton was first nominated a colleague asked me what I thought about Michael Bolton serving as National Security Advisor.  I said that Michael was a singer they meant John but that we'd be better off with Michael. And Mr. President @mbsings may still be available.

Last month 51 Americans were killed in mass shootings many more by gun violence.  The House’s background check bills could have saved some of those lives.  The cost of delay could not be clearer.  It’s time for the Senate and Trump to act.  We won't stop until they do. https://t.co/rB9nChgFi2

Bad enough Trump doctored a map about the path of a hurricane.   Worse still they would browbeat NOAA to cover up his mistake.   Still worse they threatened to fire people if they disobeyed.   There is no bottom to the dangerously abusive incompetence of this administration. https://t.co/bNsXZxWSFQ

The Department of Education rejected 99% of applicants to the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program.  So Congress expanded it.  Nothing changed. The $700 million budget was barely touched.  Teachers nurses and others are left with crushing debt.  All students deserve better. https://t.co/RjF6oX3aTk

Refusing to take up legislation that will save American lives because the president won’t like it isn’t leadership.   In fact it’s only the most sycophantic brand of cowardice.  In the House we go by the radical notion that we should make laws based on what the country needs. https://t.co/HWBdTCAQWI

The Bahamas death toll is 30 and expected to increase.  The storm caused “generational damage” that can be seen from the air.  In the Carolinas 20 tornadoes have been been reported and over 350000 have lost power.  Facts still matter.   With lives at stake they’re essential. https://t.co/7eHvl1WyhF

Trump promised Mexico would pay for his wall.  But he’s taking the money away from service members and their families instead.  From their schools and their childcare.   It’s bad enough that he lied. But now military families are paying the price. https://t.co/x42uIMNlTr

Trump made reducing trade deficits a signature issue.   With a reckless trade war with China that shows no sign of abetting he’s failed. Again. Trade deficits have only gone up - by a lot. https://t.co/siO3lPeMvD

GOP "action" on the economy:   Huge tax cut for the wealthy  Shelving the House's $15 minimum wage bill  Punting on infrastructure  Backing Trump's tariff tantrums no matter how destructive   No wonder people are worried about the economy. How could they not be? https://t.co/joMzmTHqyT

“Nations with allies thrive and those without them wither.” Jim Mattis  The British French Germans Canadians Mexicans Australians and the Danes. These are but a few of the nations we have alienated.  And that’s dangerous.   https://t.co/tvCSljaanE

Trump’s Doral is now a symbol of:  His shameless self-dealing promoting his own resort for the next G7.  His fealty to Russia asking to re-instate them against the objections of world leaders U.S. interests and good sense.  And probably bedbugs.  Talk about an infestation. https://t.co/HHyJotwcsA
The only thing worse than Trump's terrible ideas is that his officials keep trying to justify them. https://t.co/maXZf8Xg7f

I hereby order you stop jeopardizing our economy with these insane tweets.  I further hereby order our followers to retweet.  ...did that work? https://t.co/zdzdkOFg9q

“This moment in American history must be our turning point — on hate on racism on guns and violence. This must mean something to us. Our values must be worth fighting for or else what do we have left?”  https://t.co/OP6dQzOLJE

Steve King can’t figure out why white supremacy is so offensive. He can’t figure out why rape and incest are so offensive.  Basically he can’t figure out why Steve King is so offensive.  If he hasn’t figured it out by now he never will. He should resign. https://t.co/a7ihjJqDwh

Trump is trying to gut the Endangered Species Act.  The ex-lobbyist who runs the EPA praised the effort.  It’s great for oil gas and mining companies;  Terrible for polar bears beluga whales and our national heritage.  Congress will act to stop these reckless changes. https://t.co/jDtRDHnsuZ

Democrats: “If we keep the House and win the Senate and White House we'll pass gun reform expand healthcare raise wages fight climate change end family separations attack corruption and stop voter suppression."  Republicans: “We‘ll take healthcare away from millions.” https://t.co/FTZavJBO81

After the Gilroy and El Paso shooter targeted immigrants Trump ordered mass deportations.  With victims in the hospital he rambled about crowd size.  Meanwhile millions of Americans demand gun reform and an end to the hatred.  Trump lets us down but the people rise up. https://t.co/h6aXzkS3rD

Lucy McBath didn’t politicize gun violence.  Gun violence mobilized Lucy McBath.  We need more brave and compassionate voices like hers in Congress to stand up to the NRA and stand for innocent victims like her son Jordan.  Let’s show her our support: https://t.co/yME01v3Ryx

In the wake of these deadly mass shootings the GOP offers the same tired arguments.   But there is no excuse for inaction when we have the power to save lives.   We are running towards this issue not away from it and finally reaching a tipping point. It can’t come soon enough. https://t.co/Pb81U1k8ce

This is a call to action:  For meaningful gun reform.  For an end to white extremism.  For an end to hate speech.  For what the country needs.   For what the people demand.  Thanks Obama. https://t.co/ZlSYXIkfxG

In 2020 let’s not just protect the House  Let’s grow our progressive majority.   The days of writing off any seat or state are over.   In Texas Trump allies are calling it quits.  So we’re gonna start with Texas  Because we can win in Texas. https://t.co/tl6LAtdgMt

How about standing with the victims and doing something about it?  How about standing on the floor of the Senate and bringing up our bill on background checks?  Let's honor the victims of these terrible tragedies by taking action on gun violence now. https://t.co/QgdUTsAsML

Gilroy last week. El Paso this week.  Every week a new tragedy. Every week a new family has a loved one taken away.  The House passed HR 8 and HR 1112.  Mitch McConnell won’t even allow a vote.  But we have the power to do something.  We can vote them out. Enough is enough.

Michigan voters passed a measure creating an independent citizen-led redistricting commission.  Now the GOP are trying to stop it.  They’re terrified of what will happen when they can’t choose their own voters.    The stakes for democracy are high. This is worth fighting for. https://t.co/pnCqW1t6rT

Trump’s trade war hit small farmers hard  But his billion $ bailouts favor big wealthy farmers who don’t need the help  If there’s one thing Trump’s consistent about it’s helping the rich grow richer  From the biggest companies to the biggest farms — he has their back  Not yours https://t.co/SjHF8pu41D
This —> https://t.co/KpYdl2Jdgg

Mueller confirmed that Russia never stopped its interference and that they're still at it.  That's absolutely chilling.
